title: Mantle Fragment, 8th–10th century
medium:
Medium: cotton warp, camelid fiber wefts 
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous weft (tapestry), single interlock
creditline: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund
description: Fragment of a Peruvian tapestry-woven mantle with a rich ochre ground and three wide bands with highly stylized animal motifs in shades of blue, green, tan, white, black, and red, set off by narrow red guard stripes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Mantle Fragment, 8th–10th century.
8th–10th century. Medium: cotton warp, camelid fiber wefts 
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous weft (tapestry), single interlock. Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund. 1956-196-1.
